parameter.detailed-description:
B mag from USNO-B, first epoch. \\
Magnitudes from USNO-B should be used with care, photometric calibration may be severely off for some plates.\\ For objects from PPMX (bit\#1 set in "fl"), these magnitudes have a special meaning:\\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ Column [PPMX] Content \\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ b1mag [Cmag] Catalogue magnitude from source \\ b2mag [Bmag] Johnson B magnitude \\ r1mag [Rmag] calculated Ru (UCAC) magnitude from source \\ r2mag --- (always empty) \\ imag [Vmag] Johnson V magnitude \\

parameter.name: b2mag
parameter.detailed-description:
B mag from USNO-B, second epoch. \\
Magnitudes from USNO-B should be used with care, photometric calibration may be severely off for some plates.\\ For objects from PPMX (bit\#1 set in "fl"), these magnitudes have a special meaning:\\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ Column [PPMX] Content \\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ b1mag [Cmag] Catalogue magnitude from source \\ b2mag [Bmag] Johnson B magnitude \\ r1mag [Rmag] calculated Ru (UCAC) magnitude from source \\ r2mag --- (always empty) \\ imag [Vmag] Johnson V magnitude \\

parameter.name: r1mag
parameter.detailed-description:
R mag from USNO-B, first epoch. \\
Magnitudes from USNO-B should be used with care, photometric calibration may be severely off for some plates.\\ For objects from PPMX (bit\#1 set in "fl"), these magnitudes have a special meaning:\\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ Column [PPMX] Content \\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ b1mag [Cmag] Catalogue magnitude from source \\ b2mag [Bmag] Johnson B magnitude \\ r1mag [Rmag] calculated Ru (UCAC) magnitude from source \\ r2mag --- (always empty) \\ imag [Vmag] Johnson V magnitude \\

parameter.name: r2mag
parameter.detailed-description:
R mag from USNO-B, second epoch. \\
Magnitudes from USNO-B should be used with care, photometric calibration may be severely off for some plates.\\ For objects from PPMX (bit\#1 set in "fl"), these magnitudes have a special meaning:\\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ Column [PPMX] Content \\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ b1mag [Cmag] Catalogue magnitude from source \\ b2mag [Bmag] Johnson B magnitude \\ r1mag [Rmag] calculated Ru (UCAC) magnitude from source \\ r2mag --- (always empty) \\ imag [Vmag] Johnson V magnitude \\

parameter.name: imag
parameter.detailed-description:
I mag from USNO-B. \\
Magnitudes from USNO-B should be used with care, photometric calibration may be severely off for some plates.\\ For objects from PPMX (bit\#1 set in "fl"), these magnitudes have a special meaning:\\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ Column [PPMX] Content \\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ b1mag [Cmag] Catalogue magnitude from source \\ b2mag [Bmag] Johnson B magnitude \\ r1mag [Rmag] calculated Ru (UCAC) magnitude from source \\ r2mag --- (always empty) \\ imag [Vmag] Johnson V magnitude \\

parameter.name: flags
parameter.detailed-description: The flag is a bitwise or number ($\Sigma 2^i$) where each bit number (i) has the meaning:\\ \#0 (1) = if set, one of the coordinates had an excessively large chi square.\\ \#1 (2) = Row is from PPMX. These objects are mostly Tycho stars that were masked out of USNO-B. When this bit is set, the USNO magnitudes (b1mag through imag) have special meanings.\\ \#2 (4) = Row is from PPMX and replaces a single row from USNO-B. This is done when the astrometry from PPMX was better (in terms of error estimates) than the astrometry of the corresponding PPMXL object.\\ \#3 (8) = Row replaces multiple USNO-B1.0 objects. When PPMX contains an object that has more than one counterpart in PPMXL, all such counterparts are discarded on the assumption that they should have been matched in USNO-B1.0 or result from erroneous matches. For these rows, bit\#1 is always 1.\\

table.name: DPC/CU9/Operations/ExternalCatalogues/PPMXLOriginalXM
table.description: PPMXL Catalogue \\ {\bf Reference papers:}\\ PPMXL: Roeser et al. 2010, AJ 139, 2440\\ PPMX: Roeser et al. 2008,A\&A 488, 401\\ {\bf Original Catalogue:}\\ VO access: http://vo.uni-hd.de/ppmxl

parameter.name: ppmxlOid
parameter.detailed-description: Incremental unique numeric identifier (increasing with declination). This field was not in the original PPMXL catalogue, but was added for cross-match purposes.

parameter.name: ipix
parameter.detailed-description: Identifier (Q3C ipix of the USNO-B 1.0 object)

parameter.name: ra
parameter.detailed-description: J2000 right ascension with respect to the ICRS, epoch 2000.0

parameter.name: dec
parameter.detailed-description: J2000 declination with respect to the ICRS, epoch 2000.0.

parameter.name: raError
parameter.description: error at epoch J2000.0 in RAcosDEC
parameter.detailed-description: Mean error in RAcosDEC at epoch 2000.0 propagated from mean error at mean RA epoch, using the Hipparcos routine (posprop) which propagates both star positions and positional errors at different epochs.\\ Column was not present in the original catalogue.

parameter.name: decError
parameter.description: error at epoch J2000.0 in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: Mean error in DEC at epoch 2000.0 propagated from mean error at mean DEC epoch, using the Hipparcos routine (posprop) which propagates both star positions and positional errors at different epochs.\\ Column was not present in the original catalogue.

parameter.name: raErrorEpra
parameter.description: mean error at mean epoch in RAcosDEC
parameter.detailed-description: Mean error in RA*cos(DEC) at mean epoch.

parameter.name: decErrorEpde
parameter.description: mean error at mean epoch in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: Mean error in DEC at mean epoch.

parameter.name: pmra
parameter.detailed-description: Proper motion in RA*cos(DEC).\\

parameter.name: pmde
parameter.detailed-description: Proper motion in Declination.\\

parameter.name: pmraError
parameter.description: mean error in proper motion in RAcosDEC
parameter.detailed-description: Mean error in proper motion in RA*cos(DEC). \\ {\bf NB:} errors on proper motions are given in DEG/year, unit not existing in dictionary tool, will be corrected.

parameter.name: pmdeError
parameter.description: mean error in proper motion in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: Mean error in proper motion in DEC.\\ {\bf NB:} errors on proper motions are given in DEG/year, unit not existing in dictionary tool, will be corrected.

parameter.name: nEpochs
parameter.description: number of epochs used for proper motions
parameter.detailed-description: Number of catalogs (epoch) used for proper motions.\\ May be blank (null) for stars coming from ARIHIP or Tycho-2 via PPMX (i.e. bit\#1 is set in "fl").

parameter.name: epra
parameter.detailed-description: Mean Epoch for RA.

parameter.name: epde
parameter.detailed-description: Mean Epoch for DEC.

parameter.name: b1mag
parameter.detailed-description:
B mag from USNO-B, first epoch. \\
Magnitudes from USNO-B should be used with care, photometric calibration may be severely off for some plates.\\ For objects from PPMX (bit\#1 set in "fl"), these magnitudes have a special meaning:\\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ Column [PPMX] Content \\ ------------------------------------------------------------ \\ b1mag [Cmag] Catalogue magnitude from source \\ b2mag [Bmag] Johnson B magnitude \\ r1mag [Rmag] calculated Ru (UCAC) magnitude from source \\ r2mag --- (always empty) \\ imag [Vmag] Johnson V magnitude \\

parameter.detailed-description:

table.name: DPC/CU9/Operations/ExternalCatalogues/RAVE4OriginalXM
table.description: RAVEdr4 original catalog subset: stellar atmospheric parameters (effective temperature, surface gravity, overall metallicity), radial velocities, individual abundances, and distances determined for 482194 stars. See 2013AJ....146..134K and https://www.rave-survey.org/project/documentation/dr4/rave\_dr4/ In this table the APASS astrometry has been preferred (when available) to the RAVE one, a reference epoch has been added.

parameter.name: rave4Oid
parameter.detailed-description: Incremental unique numeric identifier (increasing with declination). This is the only field which was not in the original RAVE catalogue, but was added for cross-match purposes.

parameter.name: raveObsId
parameter.detailed-description: Unique Identifier for RAVE objects: Observation Date, Fieldname, Fibernumber

parameter.name: ra
parameter.detailed-description: RAVEdr4 right ascension or APASS right ascension (equinox J2000, epoch 2013) when available

parameter.name: eRa
parameter.detailed-description: right ascension error, 3 arcsec for the stars without APASS match

parameter.name: dec
parameter.detailed-description: RAVEdr4 declination or APASS declination (equinox J2000, epoch 2013) when available

parameter.name: eDec
parameter.detailed-description: declination error, 3 arcsec for the stars without APASS match

parameter.name: refEpoch
parameter.detailed-description: 2013.0 for stars with APASS astrometry, 2008.0 for RAVE stars.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Operations/ExternalCatalogues/TMassOriginalValid
table.description:
2MASS PSC Catalogue
{\bf Reference paper:} Skrutskie et al. 2006, AJ 131, 1163
Documentation: http://www.ipac.caltech.edu/2mass/releases/allsky/doc/explsup.html
{\bf Original catalogue:} ftp://ftp.ipac.caltech.edu/pub/2mass/allsky

parameter.name: phQual
tmassOid
parameter.detailed-description: Incremental unique numeric identifier (increasing with declination). This is the only field which was not in the original 2MASS catalogue, but was added for cross-match purposes.

parameter.name: designation
parameter.detailed-description: Sexagesimal, equatorial position-based source name in the form: hmmssss+ddmmsss[ABC...] The prefix "2MASS J" in not explicitely listed in the designation.

parameter.name: ra
parameter.detailed-description: J2000 right ascension with respect to the ICRS

parameter.name: dec
parameter.detailed-description: J2000 declination with respect to the ICRS

parameter.name: errMaj
parameter.detailed-description: Semi-major axis length of the one sigma position uncertainty ellipse

parameter.name: errMin
parameter.detailed-description: Semi-minor axis length of the one sigma position uncertainty ellipse

parameter.name: errAng
parameter.detailed-description: Position angle on the sky of the semi-major axis of the position uncertainty ellipse (East of North)

parameter.name: jM
parameter.detailed-description: Default J-band magnitude. \\ In case of a source not detected in the J-band, it is an upper limit and the corresponding total photometric uncertainty is NULL.\\ In case of a source detected in the J-band and with no useful brightness estimate, it is set to NULL.

parameter.name: jMsigcom
parameter.detailed-description: Total photometric uncertainty for the default J-band magnitude. This column is NULL if the default magnitude is a 95\% confidence upper limit (i.e. the source is not detected, or inconsistently deblended in the J-band).

parameter.name: hM
parameter.detailed-description: Default H-band magnitude. \\ In case of a source not detected in the H-band, it is an upper limit and the corresponding total photometric uncertainty is NULL.\\ In case of a source detected in the H-band and with no useful brightness estimate, it is set to NULL.

parameter.name: hMsigcom
parameter.detailed-description: Total photometric uncertainty for the default H-band magnitude. This column is NULL if the default magnitude is a 95\% confidence upper limit (i.e. the source is not detected, or inconsistently deblended in the H-band).

parameter.name: kM
parameter.detailed-description: Default K-band magnitude. \\ In case of a source not detected in the K-band, it is an upper limit and the corresponding total photometric uncertainty is NULL.\\ In case of a source detected in the K-band and with no useful brightness estimate, it is set to NULL.

parameter.name: kMsigcom
parameter.detailed-description: Total photometric uncertainty for the default K-band magnitude. This column is NULL if the default magnitude is a 95\% confidence upper limit (i.e. the source is not detected, or inconsistently deblended in the K-band.

parameter.name: extKey
parameter.description: UID of the record in the XSC
parameter.detailed-description: Unique identification number of the record in the XSC (2MASS Extended Source Catalogue) that corresponds to this point source. Can be NULL if no corresponding extended source is present in the XSC.

parameter.name: jDate
parameter.detailed-description: The Julian Date of the source measurement accurate to +30 seconds. This value is extrapolated from the start time of the Survey scan using the difference between the declinations of the source and the first row in the Tile divided by the scanning rate of the telescope (approximately 5sec). The scanning rate of the two 2MASS telescopes was slightly different because of the need to optimize the dithering of images on the arrays.

The scanning rate of the two 2MASS telescopes was slightly different because of the need to optimize the dithering of images on the arrays.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Operations/ExternalCatalogues/Tycho2OriginalValid
table.description: Tycho-2 Catalogue {\bf Reference paper:}\\ Hog et al. AA 355,L27, \\ Hog et al. AA 357,367, "Guide to the Tycho-2 Catalogue"\\ {\bf Original catalogue:} \\ astro.ku.dk/~erik/Tycho-2 and ftp://cdsarc.u-strasbg.fr/pub/cats/I/259 \\

parameter.name: posFlag
parameter.detailed-description: Type of Tycho-2 solution:\\ ' ' = normal treatment, close stars were subtracted when possible.\\ 'D' = double star treatment. Two stars were found. The companion is normally included as a separate Tycho-2 entry, but may have been rejected.\\ 'P' = photocentre treatment, close stars were not subtracted. This special treatment was applied to known or suspected doubles which were not successfully (or reliably) resolved in the Tycho-2 double star processing.\\

parameter.name: qraMean
parameter.description: goodness of fit for mean RA
parameter.detailed-description: This goodness of fit is the ratio of the scatter-based and the model-based error. It is only defined when the number of positions used is greater than 2. Values exceeding 9.9 are truncated to 9.9.

parameter.name: qdeMean
parameter.description: goodness of fit for mean DEC
parameter.detailed-description: This goodness of fit is the ratio of the scatter-based and the model-based error. It is only defined when the number of positions used is greater than 2. Values exceeding 9.9 are truncated to 9.9.

parameter.name: qpmra
parameter.description: goodness of fit for mean pmra
parameter.detailed-description: This goodness of fit is the ratio of the scatter-based and the model-based error. It is only defined when the number of positions used is greater than 2. Values exceeding 9.9 are truncated to 9.9.

parameter.name: qpmde
parameter.description: goodness of fit for mean pmde
parameter.detailed-description: This goodness of fit is the ratio of the scatter-based and the model-based error. It is only defined when the number of positions used is greater than 2. Values exceeding 9.9 are truncated to 9.9.

parameter.name: hipCCDM
parameter.detailed-description: HIP+CCDM\\ where:\\ HIP = Hipparcos number\\ CCDM = CCDM component identifiers for double or multiple Hipparcos stars contributing to this Tycho-2 entry. For photocentre solutions, all components within 0.8 arcsec contribute. For double star solutions any unresolved component within 0.8 arcsec contributes. For single star solutions, the predicted signal from close stars were normally subtracted in the analysis of the photon counts and such stars therefore do not contribute to the solution. The components are given in lexical order.

parameter.name: corrRaObsDeObs
parameter.detailed-description: Correlation between the observed coordinates raObs, deObs.

parameter.name: tycho2Oid
parameter.detailed-description: Incremental unique numeric identifier (increasing with declination). This field was not in the original Tycho-2 catalogue, but was added for cross-match purposes.

parameter.name: tycIdentifier
parameter.detailed-description: The TYC identifier is constructed from the GSC region number (TYC1), the running number within the region (TYC2) and a component identifier (TYC3) which is normally 1. Some non-GSC running numbers were constructed for the first Tycho Catalogue and for Tycho-2. The recommended star designation contains a hyphen between TYC numbers, e.g. TYC-0001-00013-1. Combined TYC identifier:\\ tycIdentifier = TYC-nnnn-nnnnn-n \\ in this way the identifier is a 16 char string.

parameter.name: raMean
parameter.detailed-description: The mean position is a weighted mean for all the catalogues contributing to the proper motion determination, including Tycho-2. This mean has then been brought from the mean epoch to epoch 2000.0 by the computed proper motion. For four percent of the stars only Tycho-2 position was available and neither proper motion nor mean position could be determined.\\ This column is empty for that four percent of stars, only the observed position (raObs,deObs) is available.

parameter.name: deMean
parameter.detailed-description: The mean position is a weighted mean for all the catalogues contributing to the proper motion determination, including Tycho-2. This mean has then been brought from the mean epoch to epoch 2000.0 by the computed proper motion. For four percent of the stars only Tycho-2 position was available and neither proper motion nor mean position could be determined.\\ This column is empty for that four percent of stars, only the observed position (raObs,deObs) is available.

parameter.name: raMeanError
parameter.description: mean error at epoch 2000.0 in RAcosDEC
parameter.detailed-description: Mean error in RAcosDEC at epoch 2000.0 propagated from mean error at mean RA epoch, using the Hipparcos routine (posprop) which propagates both star positions and positional errors at different epochs.\\ This field was not present in the original catalogue.

parameter.name: deMeanError
parameter.description: mean error at epoch 2000.0 in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: Mean error in DEC at epoch 2000.0 propagated from mean error at mean DEC epoch, using the Hipparcos routine (posprop) which propagates both star positions and positional errors at different epochs.\\ This field was not present in the original catalogue.

parameter.name: raMeanErrorMeanEpoch
parameter.description: Uncertainty in RA*cos(DEC) at RA mean epoch
parameter.detailed-description: Mean position uncertainty in RA*cos(DEC).

parameter.name: deMeanErrorMeanEpoch
parameter.description: Uncertainty in DEC at DEC mean epoch
parameter.detailed-description: Mean position uncertainty in DEC.

parameter.name: pmra
parameter.detailed-description: Proper motion in RA*cos(DEC)

parameter.name: pmde
parameter.detailed-description: Proper motion in DEC

parameter.name: pmraError
parameter.detailed-description: Proper motion uncertainty in RA*cos(DEC)

parameter.name: pmdeError
parameter.detailed-description: Proper motion uncertainty in DEC

parameter.name: raMeanEpoch
parameter.detailed-description: Mean Epoch in RA, in Julian years.

parameter.name: deMeanEpoch
parameter.detailed-description: Mean Epoch in DEC, in Julian years.

parameter.name: btMag
parameter.detailed-description: Tycho-2 Bt mag. NULL if no magnitude is available. Bt or Vt is always given.

parameter.name: btMagError
parameter.detailed-description: Uncertainty in BT mag

parameter.name: vtMag
parameter.detailed-description: Tycho-2 Vt mag. NULL if no magnitude is available. Bt or Vt is always given.

parameter.name: vtMagError
parameter.detailed-description: Uncertainty in VT mag

parameter.name: raObs
parameter.detailed-description: Observed Tycho-2 position. Epoch position is given in raObsEpoch and deObsEpoch.

parameter.name: deObs
parameter.detailed-description: Observed Tycho-2 position. Epoch position is given in raObsEpoch and deObsEpoch.

parameter.name: raObsError
parameter.description: Uncertainty of the observed position in RA*cos(DEC)
parameter.detailed-description: Uncertainty of the observed position in RA*cos(DEC)

parameter.name: deObsError
parameter.description: Uncertainty of the observed position in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: Uncertainty of the observed position in DEC

parameter.name: raObsEpoch
parameter.detailed-description: Observed position epoch of RA

parameter.name: deObsEpoch
parameter.detailed-description: Observed position epoch of DEC

parameter.name: pFlag
parameter.detailed-description: Position flag: \\ ' ' = normal mean position and proper motion.\\ 'P' = the mean position, proper motion, etc., refer to the photocentre of two Tycho-2 entries, where the BT magnitudes were used in weighting the positions.\\ 'X' = no mean position, no proper motion.\\

table.name: DPC/CU9/Operations/ExternalCatalogues/UCAC4Original
table.description:
UCAC4 Catalogue
{\bf Reference paper:}\\ Zacharias N., et al. 2013, AJ 145, 44
{\bf Original catalogue:}\\ DVD sent by author.

parameter.name: ucac4Oid
parameter.detailed-description: Incremental unique numeric identifier (increasing with declination). This is the only field which was not in the original UCAC4 catalogue, but was added for cross-match purposes.

parameter.name: identifier
parameter.detailed-description: Official UCAC4 star ID, in the following format:\\ UCAC4-zzz-nnnnnn\\ where zzz is the 3-digit zone number (from 001 to 900, each 0.2 deg wide) and nnnnnn the 6-digit running record number along the zone file.

parameter.name: rnm
parameter.detailed-description: This unique star identification number is between 200001 and 321640 for Hipparcos stars, and between 1 and 9430 for non Hipparcos stars supplemented to the UCAC4 catalogue (check this).\\ For all other stars this unique star identification number is the internal mean-position-file (MPOS) number + 1 million.

parameter.name: ra
parameter.detailed-description: Right ascension with respect to the ICRS at epoch J2000.0.\\ The weighted mean catalog position was updated using the provided proper motions.

parameter.name: spd
parameter.description: South Pole Distance, ICRS, epoch J2000
parameter.detailed-description: South pole distance with respect to the ICRS, at epoch J2000.0.\\ The weighted mean catalog position was updated using the provided proper motions.

parameter.name: sigra
parameter.description: s.e. at central epoch in RAcosDELTA
parameter.detailed-description: The range of values here is 1 to 255 mas.\\ There is not 0 mas value (check this); data less than 1 mas have been set to 1 mas. Original data larger than 255 mas have been set to 255.\\ If the astrometric data for a star was substituted from an external catalog like Hipparcos, Tycho or High proper motion data, a mean error in position and proper motion depending on the catalog and magnitude of the star was adopted.

parameter.name: sigdc
parameter.description: s.e. at central epoch in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: The range of values here is 1 to 255 mas.\\ There is not 0 mas value (check this); data less than 1 mas have been set to 1 mas. Original data larger than 255 mas have been set to 255.\\ If the astrometric data for a star was substituted from an external catalog like Hipparcos, Tycho or high proper motion data, a mean error in position and proper motion depending on the catalog and magnitude of the star was adopted.

parameter.name: cepra
parameter.description: Central epoch for mean RA, minus 1900
parameter.detailed-description:
cepra = (epoch - 1900 ) / 100 (unit 0.01 years)
Probably epoch is a Julian epoch expressed as Julian Years with reference J2000.0.

parameter.name: cepdc
parameter.detailed-description:
cepdc = (epoch - 1900 ) * 100 (unit 0.01 years)
Probably epoch is a Julian epoch expressed as Julian Years with reference J2000.0.

parameter.name: magm
parameter.detailed-description: Unknown, or unrealistic photometric results are set to magnitude=20 (20000 mmag in catalog).

parameter.name: maga
parameter.detailed-description: Unknown or unrealistic photometric results are set to magnitude=20 (20000 mmag entry in catalog).

parameter.name: sigmag
parameter.detailed-description: A value of 99 for error in magnitude means "no data". If the error exceeds 0.9 mag, the error was set to 0.9 mag=90 in catalog data.

parameter.name: pmrac
parameter.detailed-description: For stars without valid proper motion the proper motion data are set to 0. However, valid proper motions can also be 0. The "no data" case is indicated by the sigma proper motion columns (see sigpmr description).

parameter.name: pmdc
parameter.detailed-description: For stars without valid proper motion the proper motion data are set to 0. However, valid proper motions can also be 0. The "no data" case is indicated by the sigma proper motion columns (see sigpmd description).

parameter.name: sigpmr
parameter.description: s.e. in proper motion in RAcosDEC
parameter.detailed-description: The error in proper motion is in unit of 0.1 mas/yr, with the following exception:\\ data entries set to 500 for output tables means "no data" For astrometric data copied from the FK6, Hipparcos and Tycho-2 catalogs a mean error in positions was adopted depending on input catalog and the brightness of the star rather than giving the individual star's error quoted in those catalogs.

parameter.name: sigpmd
parameter.description: s.e. in proper motion in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: The error in proper motion is in unit of 0.1 mas/yr, with the following exception:\\ data entries set to 500 for output tables means "no data" For astrometric data copied from the FK6, Hipparcos and Tycho-2 catalogs a mean error in positions was adopted depending on input catalog and the brightness of the star rather than giving the individual star's error quoted in those catalogs.

parameter.name: objt
parameter.detailed-description: The object type flag is used to identify possible problems with a star or the source of data. \\ The object type flag has the following meaning:\\ \begin{itemize} \item 0 = good, clean star, no known problem \item 1 = largest flag of any image = near overexposed star \item 2 = largest flag of any image = possible streak object \item 3 = high proper motion (HPM) star, match with external PM file \item 4 = actually use external HPM data instead of UCAC4 observ.data (accuracy of positions varies between catalogs) \item 5 = poor proper motion solution, report only CCD epoch position \item 6 = substitute poor astrometric results by FK6/Hip/Tycho-2 data \item 7 = added supplement star (no CCD data) from FK6/Hip/Tycho-2 data, and 2 stars added from high proper motion surveys \item 8 = high proper motion solution in UCAC4, star not matched with PPMXL \item 9 = high proper motion solution in UCAC4, discrepant PM to PPMXL \end{itemize}

parameter.name: cdf
cu1
parameter.description: number of epochs used for proper motions
parameter.detailed-description: Number of catalogs (epoch) used for proper motions.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Operations/ExternalCatalogues/UCAC4OriginalValid
table.description:
UCAC4 Catalogue
{\bf Reference paper:}\\ Zacharias N., et al. 2013, AJ 145, 44
{\bf Original catalogue:}\\ DVD sent by author.

parameter.name: objt
parameter.detailed-description: The object type flag is used to identify possible problems with a star or the source of data. \\ The object type flag has the following meaning:\\ \begin{itemize} \item 0 = good, clean star, no known problem \item 1 = largest flag of any image = near overexposed star \item 2 = largest flag of any image = possible streak object \item 3 = high proper motion (HPM) star, match with external PM file \item 4 = actually use external HPM data instead of UCAC4 observ.data (accuracy of positions varies between catalogs) \item 5 = poor proper motion solution, report only CCD epoch position \item 6 = substitute poor astrometric results by FK6/Hip/Tycho-2 data \item 7 = added supplement star (no CCD data) from FK6/Hip/Tycho-2 data, and 2 stars added from high proper motion surveys \item 8 = high proper motion solution in UCAC4, star not matched with PPMXL \item 9 = high proper motion solution in UCAC4, discrepant PM to PPMXL \end{itemize}

parameter.name: cdf
ucac4Oid
parameter.detailed-description: Incremental unique numeric identifier (increasing with declination).\\ This field was not in the original UCAC4 catalogue, but was added for cross-match purposes.

parameter.name: ucac4Identifier
parameter.detailed-description: Official UCAC4 star ID, in the following format:\\ UCAC4-zzz-nnnnnn\\ where zzz is the 3-digit zone number (from 001 to 900, each 0.2 deg wide) and nnnnnn the 6-digit running record number along the zone file.

parameter.name: ra
parameter.detailed-description: Right ascension with respect to the ICRS at epoch J2000.0.\\ The weighted mean catalog position was updated using the provided proper motions. \\ {\bf NB} For objects with no proper motions, the positions are at the central epoch (which actually is UCAC4 mean observation epoch). There are 4 982 212 stars with no proper motions.

parameter.name: dec
parameter.detailed-description: Declination with respect to the ICRS, at epoch J2000.0.\\ The weighted mean catalog position was updated using the provided proper motions. \\ {\bf NB} For objects with no proper motions, the positions are at the central epoch (which actually is UCAC4 mean observation epoch). There are 4 982 212 stars with no proper motions.

parameter.name: raError
parameter.description: mean error at epoch 2000.0 in RAcosDEC
parameter.detailed-description: Mean error in RAcosDEC at epoch 2000.0 propagated from mean error at mean RA epoch, using the Hipparcos routine (posprop) which propagates both star positions and positional errors at different epochs.\\ This field was not present in the original catalogue and is null for stars with no proper motions.

parameter.name: decError
parameter.description: mean error at epoch 2000.0 in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: Mean error in DEC at epoch 2000.0 propagated from mean error at mean DEC epoch, using the Hipparcos routine (posprop) which propagates both star positions and positional errors at different epochs.\\ This field was not present in the original catalogue and is null for stars with no proper motions.

parameter.name: raErrorMeanEpoch
parameter.description: s.e. at central epoch in RAcosDEC
parameter.detailed-description: There is not 0 mas value; data less than 1 mas have been set to 1 mas. Original data larger than 255 mas have been set to 255.\\ In order to be able to calculate positional errors at any epoch, the central epoch, i.e. the weighted mean epoch of the data (UCAC + early epoch other catalogs) is given. At the central epoch (which varies from star to star and is also different for RA and Dec) the positional error has its smallest value; the one given in the catalog for "sigma position". \\ If the astrometric data for a star was substituted from an external catalog like Hipparcos, Tycho or High proper motion data, a mean error in position and proper motion depending on the catalog and magnitude of the star was adopted.\\ For stars with no proper motions only the observed CCD position and its error is reported.

parameter.name: decErrorMeanEpoch
parameter.description: s.e. at central epoch in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: There is not 0 mas value; data less than 1 mas have been set to 1 mas. Original data larger than 255 mas have been set to 255.\\ In order to be able to calculate positional errors at any epoch, the central epoch, i.e. the weighted mean epoch of the data (UCAC + early epoch other catalogs) is given. At the central epoch (which varies from star to star and is also different for RA and Dec) the positional error has its smallest value; the one given in the catalog for "sigma position". \\ If the astrometric data for a star was substituted from an external catalog like Hipparcos, Tycho or High proper motion data, a mean error in position and proper motion depending on the catalog and magnitude of the star was adopted.\\ For stars with no proper motions only the observed CCD position and its error is reported.

parameter.name: pmra
parameter.detailed-description: Proper motion in RA*cos(Dec).\\

parameter.name: pmde
parameter.detailed-description: Proper motion in Declination.\\

parameter.name: pmraError
parameter.description: s.e. in proper motion in RAcosDEC
parameter.detailed-description: For astrometric data copied from the FK6, Hipparcos and Tycho-2 catalogs a mean error in positions was adopted depending on input catalog and the brightness of the star rather than giving the individual star's error quoted in those catalogs.

parameter.name: pmdeError
parameter.description: s.e. in proper motion in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: For astrometric data copied from the FK6, Hipparcos and Tycho-2 catalogs a mean error in positions was adopted depending on input catalog and the brightness of the star rather than giving the individual star's error quoted in those catalogs.

parameter.name: meanEpochRa
parameter.detailed-description: Central Epoch for mean RA. \\ Probably epoch is a Julian epoch expressed as Julian Years with reference J2000.0. For stars with proper motions, the central epoch, i.e. the weighted mean epoch of the data (UCAC + early epoch other catalogs) is given. At the central epoch (which varies from star to star and is also different for RA and Dec) the positional error has its smallest value; the one given in the catalog for "sigma position". \\ For stars with no proper motions, the central Epoch is the UCAC4 mean observation epoch.

parameter.name: meanEpochDec
parameter.detailed-description: Central Epoch for mean DEC. \\ Probably epoch is a Julian epoch expressed as Julian Years with reference J2000.0. For stars with proper motions, the central epoch, i.e. the weighted mean epoch of the data (UCAC + early epoch other catalogs) is given. At the central epoch (which varies from star to star and is also different for RA and Dec) the positional error has its smallest value; the one given in the catalog for "sigma position". \\ For stars with no proper motions, the central Epoch is the UCAC4 mean observation epoch.

parameter.name: magm
parameter.detailed-description: Error on magnitude.\\ Systematic errors are expected to be below 0.1 mag for magm,maga photometric results obtained from the UCAC CCD pixel data. The aperture photometry is considered more robust, particularly for "odd" cases, while the model fit magnitude is expected to be more accurate for "well behaved" stars.

parameter.name: maga
parameter.detailed-description: Error on magnitude.\\ Systematic errors are expected to be below 0.1 mag for magm,maga photometric results obtained from the UCAC CCD pixel data. The aperture photometry is considered more robust, particularly for "odd" cases, while the model fit magnitude is expected to be more accurate for "well behaved" stars.

parameter.name: sigmag
parameter.detailed-description: If the error exceeds 0.9 mag, the error was set to 0.9 mag in catalog data.

parameter.name: nEpochs
parameter.description: number of epochs used for proper motions
parameter.detailed-description: Number of catalogs (epoch) used for proper motions.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Operations/ExternalCatalogues/UCAC4OriginalXM

parameter.detailed-description: There is not 0 mas value; data less than 1 mas have been set to 1 mas. Original data larger than 255 mas have been set to 255.\\ In order to be able to calculate positional errors at any epoch, the central epoch, i.e. the weighted mean epoch of the data (UCAC + early epoch other catalogs) is given. At the central epoch (which varies from star to star and is also different for RA and Dec) the positional error has its smallest value; the one given in the catalog for "sigma position". \\ If the astrometric data for a star was substituted from an external catalog like Hipparcos, Tycho or High proper motion data, a mean error in position and proper motion depending on the catalog and magnitude of the star was adopted.\\ For stars with no proper motions only the observed CCD position and its error is reported.

parameter.name: pmra
parameter.detailed-description: Proper motion in RA*cos(Dec).\\

parameter.name: pmde
parameter.detailed-description: Proper motion in Declination.\\

parameter.name: pmraError
parameter.description: s.e. in proper motion in RAcosDEC
parameter.detailed-description: For astrometric data copied from the FK6, Hipparcos and Tycho-2 catalogs a mean error in positions was adopted depending on input catalog and the brightness of the star rather than giving the individual star's error quoted in those catalogs.

parameter.name: pmdeError
parameter.description: s.e. in proper motion in DEC
parameter.detailed-description: For astrometric data copied from the FK6, Hipparcos and Tycho-2 catalogs a mean error in positions was adopted depending on input catalog and the brightness of the star rather than giving the individual star's error quoted in those catalogs.

parameter.name: meanEpochRa
parameter.detailed-description: Central Epoch for mean RA. \\ Probably epoch is a Julian epoch expressed as Julian Years with reference J2000.0. For stars with proper motions, the central epoch, i.e. the weighted mean epoch of the data (UCAC + early epoch other catalogs) is given. At the central epoch (which varies from star to star and is also different for RA and Dec) the positional error has its smallest value; the one given in the catalog for "sigma position". \\ For stars with no proper motions, the central Epoch is the UCAC4 mean observation epoch.

parameter.name: meanEpochDec
parameter.detailed-description: Central Epoch for mean DEC. \\ Probably epoch is a Julian epoch expressed as Julian Years with reference J2000.0. For stars with proper motions, the central epoch, i.e. the weighted mean epoch of the data (UCAC + early epoch other catalogs) is given. At the central epoch (which varies from star to star and is also different for RA and Dec) the positional error has its smallest value; the one given in the catalog for "sigma position". \\ For stars with no proper motions, the central Epoch is the UCAC4 mean observation epoch.

parameter.name: magm
parameter.detailed-description: Error on magnitude.\\ Systematic errors are expected to be below 0.1 mag for magm,maga photometric results obtained from the UCAC CCD pixel data. The aperture photometry is considered more robust, particularly for "odd" cases, while the model fit magnitude is expected to be more accurate for "well behaved" stars.

parameter.name: maga
parameter.detailed-description: Error on magnitude.\\ Systematic errors are expected to be below 0.1 mag for magm,maga photometric results obtained from the UCAC CCD pixel data. The aperture photometry is considered more robust, particularly for "odd" cases, while the model fit magnitude is expected to be more accurate for "well behaved" stars.

parameter.name: sigmag
parameter.detailed-description: If the error exceeds 0.9 mag, the error was set to 0.9 mag in catalog data.

parameter.name: nEpochs
parameter.description: number of epochs used for proper motions
parameter.detailed-description: Number of catalogs (epoch) used for proper motions.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Operations/ExternalCatalogues/URAT1Original
table.description: URAT-1 Catalogue\\ {\bf Reference paper: }\\ A URAT-1 release paper for the Astronomical Journal is in preparation.\\ The first U.S. Naval Observatory Astrometric Robotic Telescope Catalog (URAT1) Zacharias N., Finch C., Subasavage J., Bredthauer G., Crockett C., Divittorio M., Furguson E., Harris F., Harris H., Henden A., Kilian C., Munn J., Rafferty T., Rhodes A., Schultheiss M., Tilleman T., Wieder G. =2015yCat.1329....0Z\\ {\bf Original catalogue:} \\ CDS\\

parameter.name: urat1Oid
parameter.detailed-description: Incremental unique numeric identifier (increasing with declination).\\ This is the only field which was not in the original URAT1 catalogue, but was added for cross-match purposes.

parameter.name: urat1Identifier
parameter.detailed-description: Official URAT1 star ID numbers consist of 2 parts, the 3-digit zone number (zzz) and the 6-digit running record number (nnnnnn) along a zone.\\ Thus a URAT1 star number is given by:\\ URAT1-zzznnnnnn \\ The main catalog data are arranged in declination zones of 0.2 degree width. Zones are numbered from 1 starting at the South Pole and increasing toward north. The first zone with data in URAT1 is 326 for -25.0 to -24.8 deg Dec. There is a separate file for each zone up to zone 900 near the north celestial pole.

parameter.name: ra
parameter.detailed-description: Positions are on the International Celestial Reference System (ICRS) as represented by the UCAC4 catalog. \\ Mean observed positions are given at mean epoch of URAT observations (epoch). Thus the epoch is slightly different from star to star, but it is always in the range between 2012.311 and 2014.679.

parameter.name: spd
parameter.description: South Pole Distance, ICRS at mean epoch
parameter.detailed-description: Positions are on the International Celestial Reference System (ICRS) as represented by the UCAC4 catalog. \\ Mean observed positions are given at mean epoch of URAT observations (epoch). Thus the epoch is slightly different from star to star, but it is always in the range between 2012.311 and 2014.679.\\ Instead of Declination the always positive south pole distance is given. To obtain Declination subtract 90 degree (= 324000000 mas).

parameter.name: posError
parameter.detailed-description: posError gives an estimate of the error of the mean position components (ra and spd).\\ A mean was taken over RA and Dec component errors because they are very similar for most stars.\\ Here a model is used which include image profile fit (x,y data) errors, atmospheric turbulence, and astrometric reduction error propagations. A systematic error floor of 5 mas was added RMS. The model error is likely a better estimate of the true positional errors than the scatter error, at least for small numbers of observations.

parameter.name: epoch
parameter.detailed-description: epoch = (mean epoch of URAT observations - 2000.0 ) / 1000.0 ; unit myr.\\ Probably epoch is a Julian epoch expressed as Julian Years with reference J2000.0.\\ NB: units are myr = year / 1000.0 TO BE ADDED TO DICTIONARY TOOL

parameter.name: fMag
parameter.description: mean observerd magnitude in URAT bandpass
parameter.detailed-description: This is the mean, observed magnitude in the 680-762 nm URAT bandpass, calibrated by APASS photometry. This bandpass is between R and I, thus further into the red than UCAC. Observations in non-photometric nights *are* included thus the URAT magnitudes need to be taken with caution. Unknown or unrealistic magnitudes are set to 30000 milli-mag. The faintest maybe real celestial object magnitude is about 19.0, while the URAT1 catalog should be complete to about magnitude 18.0.

parameter.name: fMagError
parameter.detailed-description: The photometric error of URAT bandpass observations is derived from the scatter of individual observations. A systematic error floor of 0.01 mag has been RMS added. Unknown errors are indicated by 900 mmag.

parameter.name: abm
parameter.detailed-description: APASS B magnitude.\\ A custom set of APASS (The AAVSO Photometric All-Sky Survey) data was kindly provided to us by Arne Henden to include the DR8 data plus single photometric observations. \\ For a total of 71614 stars with no DR8 data the DR6 data was used.

parameter.name: avm
parameter.detailed-description: APASS V magnitude.\\ A custom set of APASS (The AAVSO Photometric All-Sky Survey) data was kindly provided to us by Arne Henden to include the DR8 data plus single photometric observations. \\ For a total of 71614 stars with no DR8 data the DR6 data was used.

parameter.name: agm
parameter.detailed-description: APASS g magnitude.\\ A custom set of APASS (The AAVSO Photometric All-Sky Survey) data was kindly provided to us by Arne Henden to include the DR8 data plus single photometric observations. \\ For a total of 71614 stars with no DR8 data the DR6 data was used.

parameter.name: arm
parameter.detailed-description: APASS r magnitude.\\ A custom set of APASS (The AAVSO Photometric All-Sky Survey) data was kindly provided to us by Arne Henden to include the DR8 data plus single photometric observations. \\ For a total of 71614 stars with no DR8 data the DR6 data was used. In case no APASS data are available, the magnitudes are set to 30000 mmag and the photometric errors to 9000 mmag.

parameter.name: aim
parameter.detailed-description: APASS i magnitude.\\ A custom set of APASS (The AAVSO Photometric All-Sky Survey) data was kindly provided to us by Arne Henden to include the DR8 data plus single photometric observations. \\ For a total of 71614 stars with no DR8 data the DR6 data was used. In case no APASS data are available, the magnitudes are set to 30000 mmag and the photometric errors to 9000 mmag.

parameter.name: ebm
parameter.detailed-description: Error on APASS B magnitude.\\ In case no APASS data are available, the magnitudes are set to 30000 mmag and the photometric errors to 9000 mmag.

parameter.name: evm
parameter.detailed-description: Error on APASS V magnitude.\\ In case no APASS data are available, the magnitudes are set to 30000 mmag and the photometric errors to 9000 mmag.

parameter.name: egm
parameter.detailed-description: Error on APASS g magnitude.\\ In case no APASS data are available, the magnitudes are set to 30000 mmag and the photometric errors to 9000 mmag.

parameter.name: erm
parameter.detailed-description: Error on APASS r magnitude.\\ In case no APASS data are available, the magnitudes are set to 30000 mmag and the photometric errors to 9000 mmag.

parameter.name: eim
parameter.detailed-description: Error on APASS i magnitude.\\ In case no APASS data are available, the magnitudes are set to 30000 mmag and the photometric errors to 9000 mmag.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Operations/ServicesMonitoring/Statistics
table.description: This table contains aggregated accesses data from Partner Data Centers. See WP954 description and GAIA-C9-TN-ASDC-GG-001

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: date
parameter.detailed-description: Statistics' reference date

parameter.name: release
parameter.detailed-description: Gaia data release number (1== first release, 2==second release....)

parameter.name: serviceName
parameter.detailed-description: Service Name

parameter.name: isProfessional
parameter.detailed-description: True if the user is a researcher, false if the user is amateur, NULL for anonymous

parameter.name: userCountry
parameter.detailed-description: User country, two letters ISO 3166 country code

parameter.name: numberUsers
parameter.description: Number of distinct users accessing the service
parameter.detailed-description: Number of distinct users accessing the service specified in the column "serviceName" at date "date"

parameter.name: numberSyncQueries
parameter.detailed-description: Number of synchronous queries

parameter.name: numberBatchQueries
parameter.detailed-description: Number of batch queries

parameter.name: dataCenter
parameter.detailed-description: Data center name

table.name: DPC/CU9/ScienceEnablingApplications/AsteroidScienceAlerts/SsoObjectAlert
table.description: Quantities needed to the valition of the SSO short-term processing

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: solutionEpoch
parameter.description: Reference epoch for the orbit solution

parameter.name: compWeiOrbMC
parameter.description: List of weights for MC solutions

parameter.name: interestObject
parameter.description: Type of object (Near Earth Object, etc.)

parameter.name: obsRADecUsed
parameter.description: Indicating which observations were used to compute the orbit

parameter.name: auxDataObject
parameter.detailed-description: Object which contains all the data of the target which is known and stored in the CU4-DU451 Auxiliary data database (cf. DPC/CU4/SSO/AuxiliaryData/SsObjectAuxData for details).

parameter.name: transits
parameter.description: Transits of the solar system object
parameter.detailed-description: Object which contains all the transits of the target.

table.name: DPC/CU9/ScienceEnablingApplications/CrossMatchCatalogues/AllWISE/AllWISEBaseCat
table.description: AllWISE implementation of BaseCat

parameter.name: covAlphaDelta
parameter.detailed-description:
covAlphaDelta = $C_{\alpha \delta} = \rho_{\alpha \delta} * \sigma_{\alpha} * \sigma_{\delta}$ : \\ covariance between the position errors alphaError ($\sigma_{\alpha}$) and deltaError ($\sigma_{\delta}$). Unit square mas.
allWISE original data for position errors include:\\ The co-sigma (coAlphaDeltaError) of the equatorial position uncertainties (alphaError and deltaError). Unit arcsec. \\ The covariance between the position errors, $C_{\alpha \delta}$ = covAlphaDelta, was derived from the co-sigma by the formula:\\ $C_{\alpha \delta} = coAlphaDeltaError * |coAlphaDeltaError|*1000.0*1000.0$.

parameter.name: extSourceId
parameter.detailed-description: Incremental unique numeric identifier (increasing with declination).

parameter.name: originalExtSourceId
parameter.description: Unique source Identifier in original catalog
parameter.detailed-description: The unique source identifier in the original catalogue.

parameter.name: alpha
parameter.detailed-description: Longitude (Right Ascension) $\alpha$ of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: delta
parameter.detailed-description: Latitude (Declination) $\delta$ of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: alphaStarError
parameter.detailed-description: Standard error $\sigma_\alpha$ of longitude (Right Ascension) of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: deltaError
parameter.detailed-description: Standard error $\sigma_\delta$ of latitude (Declination) of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: refEpoch
parameter.detailed-description: The Julian epoch to which the astrometric source parameters are referred to, expressed as Julian Years with reference J2000.0. J = 2000.0 + (JulianDate - 2451545.0) / 365.25

table.name: DPC/CU9/ScienceEnablingApplications/CrossMatchCatalogues/AllWISE/AllWISEBestNeighbour
table.description: AllWISE implementation of BaseBestNeighbour

parameter.name: allwiseOid
parameter.detailed-description: The additional numeric unique source identifier of the External catalogue, increasing with Declination.\\

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description:
Unique identifier of the Gaia source, the attribute corresponds to MDB.CU1.BasicSource.sourceId
UCD1+: meta.id

parameter.name: gaiaOid
parameter.detailed-description: Additional numeric unique identifier of the Gaia source, increasing with Declination.\\

parameter.name: originalExtSourceId
parameter.detailed-description: The unique source identifier in the original External catalogue.

parameter.name: angularDistance
parameter.description: Angular Distance between the two sources
parameter.detailed-description: Angular distance between a Gaia source and its nearest neighbour in the External Catalogue

parameter.name: angularDistanceError
parameter.detailed-description: Uncertainty on the angular distance between a Gaia source and its nearest neighbour in the External Catalogue.\\ {\bf This field should not be PUBLIC.}

parameter.name: numberOfNeighbours
parameter.description: Number of neighbours in External Catalogue
parameter.detailed-description: Number of sources in the External Catalogue which match the Gaia source within position errors.\\ The identifiers of all the neighbours can be found in the Neighbourhood table.

parameter.name: numberOfMates
parameter.description: Number of mates in Gaia Catalogue
parameter.detailed-description: Number of other Gaia sources that have as best-neighbour the same External Catalogue source.\\ In case there are no other Gaia sources with the same best-neighbour in the external catalogue, the number of mates is equal to zero.\\ Given the Gaia high angular resolution, it will happen that what appears as a single object in an external catalogue will be resolved by Gaia and as such will be the best-match of more than one Gaia object.

parameter.name: bestNeighbourMultiplicity
parameter.description: Number of neighbours with same probability as best neighbour
parameter.detailed-description: The best-match to a Gaia source in an external catalogue is the source in the external catalogue that has the highest probability to be the best-match.\\ As the probability is based on positional and density properties, it could happen that there is more than one source in the external catalogue with the same probability.\\ Even if a single best-match is always chosen, this field tells the user if there were more "best" neighbours. Those neighbours can be found in the Neighbourhood table.

parameter.name: properMotionFlag
parameter.detailed-description: This flag is set to 0 if Gaia proper motions were not available and were thus not used in the XMatch.\\ This flag is set to 1 if Gaia proper motions were available and were thus used in the XMatch (for the First Gaia release the TGASS sub-sample.\\

table.name: DPC/CU9/ScienceEnablingApplications/CrossMatchCatalogues/AllWISE/AllWISENeighbourhood
table.description: AllWISE implementation of BaseNeighbourhood

parameter.name: allwiseOid
parameter.detailed-description: The additional numeric unique source identifier of the External catalogue, increasing with Declination.\\

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description:
Unique identifier of the Gaia source, the attribute corresponds to MDB.CU1.BasicSource.sourceId
UCD1+: meta.id

parameter.name: gaiaOid
parameter.detailed-description: Additional numeric unique identifier of the Gaia source, increasing with Declination.\\

parameter.name: originalExtSourceId
parameter.detailed-description: The unique source identifier in the original External catalogue.

parameter.name: angularDistance
parameter.description: Angular Distance between the two sources
parameter.detailed-description: Angular distance between a Gaia source and its nearest neighbour in the External Catalogue

parameter.name: angularDistanceError
parameter.detailed-description: Uncertainty on the angular distance between a Gaia source and its nearest neighbour in the External Catalogue.\\ {\bf This field should not be PUBLIC.}

parameter.name: score
parameter.detailed-description: Score of a given neighbour. \\ If the cross-match is based only on geometric distance, the score is simply the order of the neighbours ordered by distance from the Gaia source. The nearest neighbour would have score=1, the second nearest would have score=2.\\ For the first Gaia release the score would be a likelihood ratio based on geometric distance and local density of the external catalogue. In the latter case the higher the score, the most probable the match is.\\

parameter.name: properMotionFlag
parameter.detailed-description: This flag is set to 0 if Gaia proper motions were not available and were thus not used in the XMatch.\\ This flag is set to 1 if Gaia proper motions were available and were thus used in the XMatch (for the First Gaia release the TGASS sub-sample.\\

table.name: DPC/CU9/ScienceEnablingApplications/CrossMatchCatalogues/BaseBestNeighbour
table.description: Base table that every crossmatch table should extend in order to inherit the common attributes pertaining to the precomputed `bestNeighbour' table approach.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description:
Unique identifier of the Gaia source, the attribute corresponds to MDB.CU1.BasicSource.sourceId
UCD1+: meta.id

parameter.name: gaiaOid
parameter.detailed-description: Additional numeric unique identifier of the Gaia source, increasing with Declination.\\

parameter.name: originalExtSourceId
parameter.detailed-description: The unique source identifier in the original External catalogue.

parameter.name: angularDistance
parameter.description: Angular Distance between the two sources
parameter.detailed-description: Angular distance between a Gaia source and its nearest neighbour in the External Catalogue

parameter.name: angularDistanceError
parameter.detailed-description: Uncertainty on the angular distance between a Gaia source and its nearest neighbour in the External Catalogue.\\ {\bf This field should not be PUBLIC.}

parameter.name: numberOfNeighbours
parameter.description: Number of neighbours in External Catalogue
parameter.detailed-description: Number of sources in the External Catalogue which match the Gaia source within position errors.\\ The identifiers of all the neighbours can be found in the Neighbourhood table.

parameter.name: numberOfMates
parameter.description: Number of mates in Gaia Catalogue
parameter.detailed-description: Number of other Gaia sources that have as best-neighbour the same External Catalogue source.\\ In case there are no other Gaia sources with the same best-neighbour in the external catalogue, the number of mates is equal to zero.\\ Given the Gaia high angular resolution, it will happen that what appears as a single object in an external catalogue will be resolved by Gaia and as such will be the best-match of more than one Gaia object.

parameter.name: bestNeighbourMultiplicity
parameter.description: Number of neighbours with same probability as best neighbour
parameter.detailed-description: The best-match to a Gaia source in an external catalogue is the source in the external catalogue that has the highest probability to be the best-match.\\ As the probability is based on positional and density properties, it could happen that there is more than one source in the external catalogue with the same probability.\\ Even if a single best-match is always chosen, this field tells the user if there were more "best" neighbours. Those neighbours can be found in the Neighbourhood table.

parameter.name: properMotionFlag
parameter.detailed-description: This flag is set to 0 if Gaia proper motions were not available and were thus not used in the XMatch.\\ This flag is set to 1 if Gaia proper motions were available and were thus used in the XMatch (for the First Gaia release the TGASS sub-sample.\\

table.name: DPC/CU9/ScienceEnablingApplications/CrossMatchCatalogues/BaseCat
table.description: This datamodel describes the generic External Catalogue to be cross-matched with the Gaia Catalogue. This is not the original External Catalogue, but is the working copy of the External Catalogue to be used for the cross-match. \\ For example many External Catalogues have string unique identifiers, while the working copy of the External Catalogue will also have an additional long unique identifier increasing with Declination.\\ {\bf BaseCat should not be PUBLIC.}

parameter.name: extSourceId
parameter.detailed-description: Incremental unique numeric identifier (increasing with declination).

parameter.name: originalExtSourceId
parameter.description: Unique source Identifier in original catalog
parameter.detailed-description: The unique source identifier in the original catalogue.

parameter.name: alpha
parameter.detailed-description: Longitude (Right Ascension) $\alpha$ of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: delta
parameter.detailed-description: Latitude (Declination) $\delta$ of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: alphaStarError
parameter.detailed-description: Standard error $\sigma_\alpha$ of longitude (Right Ascension) of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: deltaError
parameter.detailed-description: Standard error $\sigma_\delta$ of latitude (Declination) of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: refEpoch
parameter.detailed-description: The Julian epoch to which the astrometric source parameters are referred to, expressed as Julian Years with reference J2000.0. J = 2000.0 + (JulianDate - 2451545.0) / 365.25

parameter.description: Number of neighbours in External Catalogue
parameter.detailed-description: Number of sources in the External Catalogue which match the Gaia source within position errors.\\ The identifiers of all the neighbours can be found in the Neighbourhood table.

parameter.name: numberOfMates
parameter.description: Number of mates in Gaia Catalogue
parameter.detailed-description: Number of other Gaia sources that have as best-neighbour the same External Catalogue source.\\ In case there are no other Gaia sources with the same best-neighbour in the external catalogue, the number of mates is equal to zero.\\ Given the Gaia high angular resolution, it will happen that what appears as a single object in an external catalogue will be resolved by Gaia and as such will be the best-match of more than one Gaia object.

parameter.name: bestNeighbourMultiplicity
parameter.description: Number of neighbours with same probability as best neighbour
parameter.detailed-description: The best-match to a Gaia source in an external catalogue is the source in the external catalogue that has the highest probability to be the best-match.\\ As the probability is based on positional and density properties, it could happen that there is more than one source in the external catalogue with the same probability.\\ Even if a single best-match is always chosen, this field tells the user if there were more "best" neighbours. Those neighbours can be found in the Neighbourhood table.

parameter.name: properMotionFlag
parameter.detailed-description: This flag is set to 0 if Gaia proper motions were not available and were thus not used in the XMatch.\\ This flag is set to 1 if Gaia proper motions were available and were thus used in the XMatch (for the First Gaia release the TGASS sub-sample.\\

table.name: DPC/CU9/ScienceEnablingApplications/CrossMatchCatalogues/RAVE4/RAVE4Neighbourhood
table.description: RAVE-4 implementation of BaseNeighbourhood

parameter.name: rave4Oid
parameter.detailed-description: The additional numeric unique source identifier of the External catalogue, increasing with Declination.\\

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description:
Unique identifier of the Gaia source, the attribute corresponds to MDB.CU1.BasicSource.sourceId
UCD1+: meta.id

parameter.name: gaiaOid
parameter.detailed-description: Additional numeric unique identifier of the Gaia source, increasing with Declination.\\

parameter.name: originalExtSourceId
parameter.detailed-description: The unique source identifier in the original External catalogue.

parameter.name: angularDistance
parameter.description: Angular Distance between the two sources
parameter.detailed-description: Angular distance between a Gaia source and its nearest neighbour in the External Catalogue

parameter.name: angularDistanceError
parameter.detailed-description: Uncertainty on the angular distance between a Gaia source and its nearest neighbour in the External Catalogue.\\ {\bf This field should not be PUBLIC.}

parameter.name: score
parameter.detailed-description: Score of a given neighbour. \\ If the cross-match is based only on geometric distance, the score is simply the order of the neighbours ordered by distance from the Gaia source. The nearest neighbour would have score=1, the second nearest would have score=2.\\ For the first Gaia release the score would be a likelihood ratio based on geometric distance and local density of the external catalogue. In the latter case the higher the score, the most probable the match is.\\

parameter.name: properMotionFlag
parameter.detailed-description: This flag is set to 0 if Gaia proper motions were not available and were thus not used in the XMatch.\\ This flag is set to 1 if Gaia proper motions were available and were thus used in the XMatch (for the First Gaia release the TGASS sub-sample.\\

table.name: DPC/CU9/ScienceEnablingApplications/CrossMatchCatalogues/TMass/TMassBaseCat
table.description: 2MASS implementation of BaseCat

parameter.name: covAlphaDelta
parameter.description: Covariance between right ascension and declination
parameter.detailed-description:
covAlphaDelta = $C_{\alpha \delta} = \rho_{\alpha \delta} * \sigma_{\alpha} * \sigma_{\delta}$ : \\ covariance between rightAscension and Declination.
2MASS original data for position errors include:\\ - semi-major axis errMaj\\ - semi-minor axis errMin\\ - position angle (from North to Est) errAng.
From the above quantities, it is possible to calculate:\\ $alphaError^{2} = \sigma^{2}_{\alpha} = errMaj^{2} * \sin^{2}(errAng) + errMin^{2} * \cos^{2}(errAng)$ \\ $deltaError^{2} = \sigma^{2}_{\delta} = errMaj^{2} * \cos^{2}(errAng) + errMin^{2} * \sin^{2}(errAng)$ \\ $covAlphaDelta = C_{\alpha \delta} = \sin(errAng) * \cos(errAng) * [ errMaj^{2} - errMin^{2} ]$

parameter.name: extSourceId
parameter.detailed-description: Incremental unique numeric identifier (increasing with declination).

parameter.name: originalExtSourceId
parameter.description: Unique source Identifier in original catalog
parameter.detailed-description: The unique source identifier in the original catalogue.

parameter.name: alpha
parameter.detailed-description: Longitude (Right Ascension) $\alpha$ of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: delta
parameter.detailed-description: Latitude (Declination) $\delta$ of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: alphaStarError
parameter.detailed-description: Standard error $\sigma_\alpha$ of longitude (Right Ascension) of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: deltaError
parameter.detailed-description: Standard error $\sigma_\delta$ of latitude (Declination) of object in ICRS at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: refEpoch
parameter.detailed-description: The Julian epoch to which the astrometric source parameters are referred to, expressed as Julian Years with reference J2000.0. J = 2000.0 + (JulianDate - 2451545.0) / 365.25
