The different orders $k$ are statistics of the scan directions modulo $360^\circ/k$. For example, at first order ($k=1$), $\theta=10^\circ$ and $\theta=190^\circ$ count as different directions, but at second order ($k=2$) they are the same. Thus, scanDirectionMean[0] is the mean direction when the sense of direction is taken into account, while scanDirectionMean[1] is the mean direction without regard to the sense of the direction. For example, scanDirectionMean[0] = 0 means that the scans preferentially go towards North, while scanDirectionMean[1] = 0 means that they preferentially go in the North-South direction, and scanDirectionMean[4] = 0 that they preferentially go either in the North-South or in the East-West direction.

parameter.name: photGNObs
parameter.description: Number of observations contributing to G photometry
parameter.detailed-description: Number of observations that contributed to the G mean flux and mean flux error. This number will be set to 0 if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: photGMeanFlux
parameter.detailed-description: Mean flux in the G-band. This number will be set to NaN if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: photGMeanFluxError
parameter.detailed-description: Error on the mean flux in the G-band. This number will be set to NaN if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: photGMeanMag
parameter.detailed-description: Mean magnitude in the G band. This is computed from the G-band mean flux applying the magnitude zero-point in the AB scale. This number will be set to NaN if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: photBpNObs
parameter.description: Number of observations contributing to BP photometry
parameter.detailed-description: Number of observations that contributed to the integrated BP mean flux and mean flux error. This number will be set to 0 if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: photBpMeanFlux
parameter.detailed-description: Mean flux in the integrated BP band. This number will be set to NaN if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: photBpMeanFluxError
parameter.description: Error on the integrated BP mean flux
parameter.detailed-description: Error on the mean flux in the integrated BP band. This number will be set to NaN if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: photBpMeanMag
parameter.detailed-description:
Mean magnitude in the integrated BP band. This is computed from the BP-band mean flux applying the magnitude zero-point in the AB scale.
This number will be set to NaN if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: photRpNObs
parameter.description: Number of observations contributing to RP photometry
parameter.detailed-description: Number of observations that contributed to the integrated RP mean flux and mean flux error. This number will be set to 0 if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: photRpMeanFlux
parameter.detailed-description: Mean flux in the integrated RP band.

parameter.name: photRpMeanFluxError
parameter.description: Error on the integrated RP mean flux
parameter.detailed-description: Error on the mean flux in the integrated RP band. This number will be set to NaN if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: photRpMeanMag
parameter.detailed-description:
Mean magnitude in the integrated RP band. This is computed from the RP-band mean flux applying the magnitude zero-point in the AB scale.
This number will be set to NaN if no observation for this source was considered suitable for photometric accumulation.

parameter.name: radialVelocity
parameter.detailed-description: Radial Velocity of the object: the radial velocity provided will be the combination of the RV measurements at all epochs (covered by R1). Specifically, it is the spectroscopic radial velocity in the solar baricentric reference frame.

parameter.name: radialVelocityError
parameter.description: Standard error of the Radial Velocity
parameter.detailed-description: Standard error $\sigma_{v_r}$ of Radial Velocity of the object at reference epoch {\tt refEpoch}

parameter.name: radialVelocityConstancyProbability
parameter.description: probability of constancy of radial velocity

parameter.name: photVariableFlag

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/ClusterValidation/CluValIntermediate/CluValTest010
table.description: The test intends to check the proper motion systematic errors as function of the magnitude in the HTPMC. We will test the spatial and magnitude properties of relative proper motions rather than absolute values

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: cluName
parameter.detailed-description: name of the cluster

parameter.name: muAlphaAve
parameter.description: average cluster proper motion in Alpha
parameter.detailed-description: Clsuter pm in alpha as derived from Gaia data

parameter.name: muAlphaSigma
parameter.detailed-description: standard error on pm in alpha as function of magnitude as derived from Gaia data

parameter.name: muAlphaGmagSlope
parameter.detailed-description: slope of the fit pm in alpha vs magnitude G

parameter.name: muDeltaAve
parameter.detailed-description: clsuter pm in Delta

parameter.name: muDeltaSigma
parameter.detailed-description: standard error on pm in delta as function of the magnitude G

parameter.name: muDeltaGmagSlope
parameter.detailed-description: slope of pm in Delta vs G fit

parameter.name: muAphaAcceptanceFlag
parameter.detailed-description: acceptance flag of mu Alpha uncertainty

parameter.name: muDeltaAcceptanceFlag
parameter.detailed-description: acceptance flag of mu Delta uncertainty as function of magnitude for the whole cluster

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/ClusterValidation/CluValIntermediate/CluValTest020
table.description: The test intends to study small angular scale of astrometric correlations. This can be done deriving the separation among stars in the cluster from Gaia data and from external data. The test will be done for faint Gaia stars only using high precision HST relative positions.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: cluName
parameter.detailed-description: cluster name

parameter.name: meanSepExternal
parameter.description: mean star separation from external data
parameter.detailed-description: mena separation of the stars from external data.

parameter.name: meanSepGaia
parameter.description: mean star separation from Gaia data
parameter.detailed-description: mean separtion of teh stars in the Gaia data

parameter.name: coordSystematicFlag
parameter.description: Acceptance Flag based on unertainty on positions
parameter.detailed-description: acceptance flag based on the uncertainty on the posistions

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/ClusterValidation/CluValIntermediate/CluValTest050
table.description: The goal is to test the photometric consistency. The test will: the external photometry can be used to predict G magnitude and compare with the same quantitie in Gaia catalog to detec systematics The completeness of Gaia data at the faint magnitude end will be tested by comparison with HST photometry

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: cluName
parameter.detailed-description: name of the cluster

parameter.name: nBand
parameter.detailed-description: number of external photometric passbands used for the test

parameter.name: gMagExternalCatalog
parameter.detailed-description: G mag as derived from external phtometry

parameter.name: gPassbandExtCat
parameter.detailed-description: external photomnetric passband used to calculate the G magnitude

parameter.name: nMagBin
parameter.detailed-description: number of magnitude bins used in the test

parameter.name: gMagSigma
parameter.detailed-description: unceratinty on the G magnitude bin as derived for comparison with external photmetry

parameter.name: gMagAcceptanceFlag
parameter.detailed-description: acceptance flag for the G mag uncertainty

parameter.name: gMagCompletenssFlag
parameter.detailed-description: acceptance flag for the completeness in the mag bin

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: gwp947Val010Test01
parameter.description: proper motion in Alpha vs G systematics

parameter.name: gwp947Val010Test02
parameter.description: proper motion in Delta vs Gmag

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/GATValidation/ValidationFlagCounts
table.description: Verification of completeness for all the type of objects in the Gaia catalogue

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: typeObject
parameter.detailed-description: If the object is a single star, binary, QSO, SN and so on.

parameter.name: wp942Val120Test010
parameter.description: Completness for all the type of objects
parameter.detailed-description: This test verifies the amount of objects for each type.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/GATValidation/ValidationFlagField
table.description: These test intends to check the global distribution for all the fields in the Gaia catalogue, the detected maximum and minimum values, the mean and std deviation also will be checked. The amount of sources inside a range will be evaluated as well.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: fieldName
parameter.detailed-description: Field name

parameter.name: wp942Val110Test010
parameter.detailed-description: All fields have a detected minimum and maximum values.

parameter.name: wp942Val110Test020
parameter.detailed-description: All fields have a detected mean and standard deviation according with their distribution.

parameter.name: wp942Val120Test020
parameter.description: Amount of sources inside a range
parameter.detailed-description: Verification of the amount of sources inside a range for each field.

parameter.name: wp942Val130Test010
parameter.detailed-description: Verification of the distribution consistency for all the fields in the Gaia catalogue.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/GATValidation/ValidationGATFunc
table.description: These tests verify that the GAT joiner and the GAT report containing the statistics are generated accordingly.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: wp942Val140Test010
parameter.detailed-description: Verification if the GAT report is generated accordingly.

parameter.name: wp942Val150Test010
parameter.detailed-description: This test verifies if the SAMs and VAMs modules can be joined adequately (e.g. running GAT in a distributed system).

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description: A unique single numerical identifer of the source - is obtained from CompleteSource

parameter.name: wp942Val230Test010
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-230-010 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies stars that are members of binaries are correctly flagged as such in the Gaia catalogue. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val230Test020
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-230-020 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that physically nearby stars have common proper motions. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val230Test020Companions
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of sourceIds located near enough in three-dimensional space to be probable companion stars. The field equals the empty string if the star is believed to be single.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/InternalConsistency/BrightStarProblem
table.description: This table have an entry for every Gaia sources observed sources close (i.e. within distanceFromBrightStar) to a bright star (i.e. sourceIdFromBrightStar), and is exclusively used for the VTS WP942-VAL-220-010. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OMP-FA-061.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description: A unique single numerical identifer of the source - is obtained from CompleteSource

parameter.name: sourceIdOfBrightStar
parameter.detailed-description: A unique single numerical identifer of a bright source - is obtained from CompleteSource. This bright source (i.e. sourceIdOfBrightStar) corresponds to the bright stars considered in the VTS WP942-Val-220-010.

parameter.name: distanceFromBrightStar
parameter.detailed-description: Distance, in degree, from the bright stars (i.e. sourceIdOfBrightStar) for which its blooming could produce detections of artefacts.

parameter.name: wp942Val220Test1020
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test cases WP942-VAL-220-010 and WP942-VAL-220-020 have both passed, or if one (or both) have failed. For "wp942Val220Test" to be true, both WP942-VAL-220-010 and WP942-VAL-220-020 need to pass. The first VTS WP942-VAL-220-010 verifies that there are no artefact or ghost close to a bright source. (e.g. This test will fail if we suspect the presence of an artefact close to a very bright star) The second VTS WP942-VAL-220-020 verifies that there are no faint stars too close to a bright star. For more informations about the two VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description: A unique single numerical identifer of the source - is obtained from CompleteSource

parameter.name: wp942Val430Test030
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-430-030 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that cross-matching e.g. for High Proper Motion (HPM) or Non-Single Stars (NSS) is correct. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val430Test040
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-430-040 has pass or failed. This VTS verifies that there cross-matching (stars-SSO) is correct. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/InternalConsistency/DistributionAndCompleteness
table.description: This table have only one entry for the whole Gaia catalogue. It contains all the flags (warnings) which might have been generated during the validation of the Gaia catalogue by the VTS on distribution and completeness of the Gaia catalogue. For more informations about these VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OMP-FA-061.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test010
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-310-010 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that there is a correct distribution of the parameters provided in the Gaia catalogue. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test020
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-310-020 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies the various statistics on each parameters provided in the Gaia catalogue are correct. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test030
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-310-030 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that there is a correct distribution of parameters for a given type of objects. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test040
parameter.description: Correct amount of sources within a range for a given parameters
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-310-040 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that there is a correct distribution of parameters for a given type of objects. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test050
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-310-030 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that there is a correct distribution of parameters for a given type of objects. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test060
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-310-060 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that measurements do not show systematic variations across the sky. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test060Fields
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the names of all columns that were tested for WP942-VAL-310-060, whether or not they passed.

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test060Lats
parameter.description: Coordinates of local extrema in mean measurements.
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the latitudes of the most extreme local minima or local maxima in the mean values of the corresponding columns given by wp942Val310Test060Fields. It must have the same length as wp942Val310Test060Fields.

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test060Longs
parameter.description: Coordinates of local extrema in mean measurements.
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the longitudes of the most extreme local minima or local maxima in the mean values of the corresponding columns given by wp942Val310Test060Fields. It must have the same length as wp942Val310Test060Lats.

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test060Outliers
parameter.description: Values of local extrema in mean measurements.
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the most extreme local minima or local maxima in the mean values of the corresponding columns given by wp942Val310Test060Fields. It must have the same length as wp942Val310Test060Fields.

parameter.name: wp942Val310Test060Baselines
parameter.description: Comparison standards of local extrema in mean measurements.
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the local average used to flag the local minima or local maxima given in wp942Val310Test060Outliers. It must have the same length as wp942Val310Test060Outliers.

parameter.name: wp942Val320Test010
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-320-010 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that there are no missing sources or holes. (This VTS also looks for holes in the catalogues.) For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val320Test010Fields
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the names of any columns that have incorrect dimensions for this (solutionId, sourceId). If sourceId is on the list, it means that sources are missing in part of the sky. If wp942Val320Test010 == true, then this field should be the empty string.

parameter.name: wp942Val320Test010Lats
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the latitudes of the largest spatial holes in the columns given by wp942Val320Test010Fields. It must have the same length as wp942Val320Test010Fields.

parameter.name: wp942Val320Test010Longs
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the longitudes of the largest spatial holes in the columns given by wp942Val320Test010Fields. It must have the same length as wp942Val320Test010Lats.

parameter.name: wp942Val320Test011
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-320-0110 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that there are gaps in data distributions. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val320Test011Fields
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the names of any columns that have incorrect dimensions for this (solutionId, sourceId). If wp942Val320Test011 == true, then this field should be the empty string.

parameter.name: wp942Val320Test011Lats
parameter.description: Locations of gaps in measurement values.
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the locations of the largest value gaps in the columns given by wp942Val320Test011Fields. It must have the same length as wp942Val320Test011Fields.

parameter.name: wp942Val320Test020
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-320-020 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that there is the expected completeness in magnitude. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val320Test030
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-320-030 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that close doubles can be correctly split into two sources. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val320Test030Threshold
parameter.description: The resolution limit at which sources can be split.
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains the limit (exact definition TBD) at which sources can no longer be resolved by the Gaia blended source pipeline.

parameter.name: wp942Val330Test020
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-330-020 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that small-scale correlations are within expected limits. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val330Test020MaxRatio
parameter.description: Worst deviation of ACF from predictions
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains the largest ratio of the measured angular correlation function to the expected/desired function.

parameter.name: wp942Val330Test020WorstAngle
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains the angular separation at which wp942Val330Test020MaxRatio is measured.

parameter.name: wp942Val340Test010
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-340-010 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that formal parallax errors are close to true errors. For more information about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val340Test010Error
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains an estimate of the parallax error, as derived from the parallax distribution.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/InternalConsistency/FlagSource
table.description: This table have an entry for every Gaia observed source. It contains all the flags (warnings) which might have been generated during the validation of the Gaia catalogue by the VTS on individual sources and pairs. For more informations about the VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description: A unique single numerical identifer of the source - is obtained from CompleteSource

parameter.name: wp942Val110Test010
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-110-010 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that no entry in the Gaia catalogue are NaN. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val110Test010Fields
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the names of any columns that equal NaN for this (solutionId, sourceId). If wp942Val110Test010 == true, then this field should be the empty string.

parameter.name: wp942Val110Test020
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-110-020 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that there are no empty values (i.e. no Null entry) in the Gaia catalogue. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val110Test020Fields
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited listo f the names of any columns that equal null for this (solutionId, sourceId). If wp942Val110Test020 == true, then this field should be the empty string.

parameter.name: wp942Val110Test030
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-110-030 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that all values provided in the catalogue are all in their expected ranges. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val110Test030Fields
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the names of any columns that have invalid values for this (solutionId, sourceId). If wp942Val110Test030 == true, then this field should be the empty string.

parameter.name: wp942Val110Test040
parameter.description: All array fields have correct dimensions
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-110-040 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that all array values provided in the catalogue have the expected dimensions. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val110Test040Fields
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a space-delimited list of the names of any columns that have incorrect dimensions for this (solutionId, sourceId). If wp942Val110Test040 == true, then this field should be the empty string.

parameter.name: wp942Val120Test010
parameter.description: Source brightness inconsistent with available source data
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-120-010 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that values are correctly provided, given the brightness of the source. (e.g. If an object is too faint for having RVS measurments, than no RVS data should be provided.) For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val120Test011
parameter.description: Source brightness inconsistent with Tycho ID
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-120-011 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that Tycho cross-matches exist where expected and don't exist where not expected, given the brightness of the source. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val120Test020
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-120-020 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that the errors on the various measurments are consistant between each other. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val120Test020FieldPairs
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a list, delimited by spaces, containing the names of any pairs of error fields that have inconsistent values. The pairs are wrapped in parentheses (e.g. "(alphaError deltaError) (muAlphaError muDeltaError)"). If wp942Val120Test020 == true, then this field should be the empty string.

parameter.name: wp942Val120Test030
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-120-030 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that the physical parameters are consistant between each other. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val120Test030FieldPairs
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a list, delilmited by spaces, containing the names of any pairs of physical fields that have inconsistent values. The pairs are wrapped in parentheses (see wp942Val120Test020FieldPairs for an example). If wp942Val120Test030 == true, then this field should be the empty string.

parameter.name: wp942Val120Test030ValuePairs
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a list, delimited by spaces, containing the values of any pairs of physical fields that have inconsistent values, \emph{after} any transformations needed to make them comparable. The pairs are wrapped in parentheses, as for wp942Val120Test030FieldPairs. This field must have the same length as wp942Val120Test030FieldPairs.

parameter.name: wp942Val120Test031
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-120-031 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that proper motions and parallaxes are consistant between each other. For more information about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val210Test010
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-210-010 has pass or failed. This VTS verifies that there are no duplicates in the catalogue based on their sourceIds (a condition not guaranteed by all data formats, e.g. gBins). For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val210Test010Count
parameter.detailed-description: This list contains the number of sources with sourceId. If wp942Val210Test010 == true, then this field must be 1; otherwise, it must be greater than 1.

parameter.name: wp942Val210Test020
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-210-020 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that there are no duplicates in the catalogue based on their positions. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val210Test020Neighbors
parameter.detailed-description: This contains a space-delimited list of any other sourceIds that have the same position as this sourceID. If wp942Val210Test020 == true, then this field should be the empty string.

parameter.name: wp942Val210Test020Distances
parameter.detailed-description: This list a space-delimited list of the distances to the sources in wp942Val210Test020Neighbors, in floating-point format. It must have the same number of entries as wp942Val120Test030FieldPairs.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/InternalConsistency/HardwareSoftwareProblems
table.description: This table have only one entry for the whole Gaia catalogue. It contains all the flags (warnings) which might have been generated during the validation of the Gaia catalogue by the VTS on hardware and software problems, including calibration problems. For more informations about these VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OMP-FA-061.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: wp942Val420Test010
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-420-010 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that the data processing was correct. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val430Test020
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-430-020 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that there are no issues with the integrator. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val430Test080
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-430-080 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that observed sources are not split in two if matched to a (nonexistant) double in the IGSL catalogue. For more information about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val430Test080BadPairs
parameter.description: List of sources that should be merged
parameter.detailed-description: This field contains a list, delimited by spaces, containing the sourceIds of any pairs of sources that were incorrectly split. The pairs are wrapped in parentheses (e.g. "(1234 1235) (6789 6790)"). If wp942Val430Test080 == true, then this field should be the empty string.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/InternalConsistency/TestExecution
table.description: This table have only one entry for the whole Gaia catalogue. It contains all the flags (warnings) whicvh might have been generated during the validation of the Gaia catalogue by the VTS on test execution. For more informations about these VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OMP-FA-061.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: wp942Val510Test010
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-510-010 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that the correct GAT report is generated. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val510Test020
parameter.description: Correct GAT report joined from sub-runs
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-510-020 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that the GAT report was correctly joined to sub-runs. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val520Test010
parameter.description: Ability in querying large amount of data
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-520-010 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that it is possible to query large amount of data from the Gaia catalogue. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

parameter.name: wp942Val520Test020
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the validation test case WP942-VAL-520-020 has passed or failed. This VTS verifies that it is possible to perform fuzzy query to the Gaia catalogue. For more informations about this VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OPM-FA-061.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/Models/BGMBTG
table.description: Besançon model, ...

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: nc
parameter.detailed-description: nb of components (a component can be either one object or a system)

parameter.name: nt
parameter.detailed-description: total number of objects (stars, brown dwarfs or exoplanets) in the sys

parameter.name: host
parameter.detailed-description: 1=Milky Way, 2=SMC, 3=LMC, 4=M31, a complete list should be given

parameter.name: astrometry
parameter.detailed-description: Astrometric parameters (coordinates, parallax, proper motion and radial velocity)

parameter.name: photometry
parameter.description: The stellar source photometry (only G, Gbp,Grp,Grvs)
parameter.detailed-description: Photometry: G, Gbp, Grp and Grvs magnitudes

parameter.name: meanAbsoluteV
parameter.detailed-description: Mean absolute V magnitude

parameter.name: colorVminusI
parameter.detailed-description: Mean intrinsic V-I color

parameter.name: semimajorAxis
parameter.detailed-description: Para hyperbolic orbits will use perihelion distance instead

parameter.name: eccentricity
parameter.detailed-description: Eccentricity of the orbit (for multiple systems)

parameter.name: periastronArgument
parameter.detailed-description: Periastron argument of the orbit (multiple systems)

parameter.name: inclination
parameter.detailed-description: Inclination of the orbit (multiple systems)

parameter.name: longitudeAscendingNode
parameter.detailed-description: Longitude of the ascending node of the orbit (multiple systems)

parameter.name: phase
parameter.detailed-description: For exoplanet only: angle Sun-satellite-exoplanet at J2010 reference epoch

parameter.name: flagInteracting
parameter.detailed-description: Defined only if source is a stellar system: 0=Keplerian motion, 1=interacting system, 2=mass exchange

parameter.name: population
parameter.detailed-description: 1=thin disc,2= thick disc,3= spheroid, 4=bulge

parameter.name: age
parameter.detailed-description: Age of the stetllar source (Gyr)

parameter.name: feH
parameter.detailed-description: Metallicity [Fe/H]

parameter.name: alphaFe
parameter.detailed-description: Alpha elements abundance

parameter.name: mbol
parameter.description: Absolute bolometric magnitude at J2010 reference epoch
parameter.detailed-description: Mean absolute bolometric magnitude

parameter.name: mass
parameter.detailed-description: Mass [Solar masses]

parameter.name: radius
parameter.detailed-description: Radius (mean value for variable pulsating stars)

parameter.name: teff
parameter.detailed-description: Effective temperature for stars, equilibrium temperature for exoplanets

parameter.name: logg
parameter.detailed-description: Surface gravity log g

parameter.name: spectralType
parameter.detailed-description: For stars only, MK classifcation

parameter.name: vsini
parameter.detailed-description: For stars only: v=equatorial velocity, i=angle between rotation axis and line of sight

parameter.name: rEnvRStar
parameter.detailed-description: Envelop characteristic parameter for Be stars

parameter.name: bondAlbedo
parameter.detailed-description: For exoplanet only: Bond albedo in the V band

parameter.name: geomAlbedo
parameter.detailed-description: For exoplanet only: geometric albedo in the V band

parameter.name: variabilityType
parameter.detailed-description: Deltascuti, ACV, cepheid, RRab, RRc, roAp, semiregular, microlens, dwarfnovae, mira,Flaring, be, DYPer, RCrBs, 0 if no variability

parameter.name: variabilityAmplitude
parameter.detailed-description: Amplitude in V magnitude

parameter.name: variabilityPeriod
parameter.detailed-description: Variability period [days]

parameter.name: variabilityPhase
parameter.detailed-description: Phase at J2010 reference epoch

parameter.name: hasPhotocenterMotion
parameter.description: Boolean describing if the photocenter has or not motion
parameter.detailed-description: Field to describe if the photocenter has or not motion

parameter.name: openClusterName
parameter.description: Name of the open cluster to which the object belongs (NULL if none)
parameter.detailed-description: Name of the open cluster to which the object belongs (NULL if none)

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/StatisticalTools/SelfOrgMap
table.description: A Self-Organizing Map is a model which describes an observation set. The model is composed by a 2D lattice of neurons. Each neuron represents a cluster of observations. The neurons are related each other according to the lattice, so that it is possible to visualize their distribution. The SOM is very useful for data exploration and navigation.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: somId
parameter.detailed-description: Unique identifier of the Self-Organizing Map

parameter.name: neurons
parameter.detailed-description: Matrix with N rows and M columns, each cell representing a neuron of the SOM (a cluster of observations).

parameter.name: quality
parameter.description: Quality of the map at convergence
parameter.detailed-description: Quality of the SOM. The quality is calculated as the average distance from the observations to the neuron prototypes which they are assigned to, at the time of convergence.

parameter.name: comment
parameter.detailed-description: Comments of the researcher about this SOM.

parameter.name: classifierVersion
parameter.detailed-description: Version of the algorithm used for training this SOM.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/StatisticalTools/SelfOrgMapIdentification
table.description: This table represents the association between a cluster (a neuron in the SOM) and a source, so that the source is identified with one neuron in the map. This way, it is possible to know if the source is an inlier or an outlier, and to retrieve the most similar sources in the training set.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: somId
parameter.detailed-description: Unique identifier of the SOM.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description: Unique identifier of the source.

parameter.name: neuronId
parameter.detailed-description: References to neuronId in table SelfOrgMapNeuron

parameter.name: distance
parameter.detailed-description: Squared euclidean distance between the source properties and the properties of the closest neuron prototype among the neurons in the SOM.

parameter.name: belongProp
parameter.detailed-description: Probability of the object belonging to the assigned neuron. Such probability is calculated by means of modelling the (normal) distribution of the objects belonging to the neuron in the training space.

parameter.name: isOutlier
parameter.detailed-description: True if the belongProb of the source is below a given threshold (TBD)

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/StatisticalTools/SelfOrgMapNeuron
table.description: A neuron is a model of a group of sources in a dataset. The model consists in the multidimensional mean of the sources (the neuron prototype) and the standard deviation of the sources with respect to the prototype. It is called neuron instead of cluster since the SOM comes from the neural networks field.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: somId
parameter.detailed-description: Unique identifier of the SOM which the neuron belongs to.

parameter.name: prototype
parameter.detailed-description: Prototype of the neuron, representing the sources that activate it. It is calculated by the mean of the sources assigned to the neuron.

parameter.name: prototypeError
parameter.detailed-description: Standard deviation of the neuron, calculated as the deviation of the sources assigned to the neuron with respect to the prototype.

parameter.name: hits
parameter.detailed-description: Number of sources assigned to this neuron.

parameter.name: neuronId
parameter.detailed-description: Unique identifier of the neuron

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/ValidationFlagsSource
table.description: This table have an entry for every Gaia observed sources. It containts the main validation flag "accepted" which is set, in accordance with the other warnings and flags, to characterise if the source may be published or not. For more information about the VTS, refer to GAIA-C9-SP-OMP-FA-061.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description: A unique single numerical identifer of the source - is obtained from CompleteSource

parameter.name: accepted
parameter.detailed-description: This flag indicates if the source is accepted for publication after the CU9 validation. It is set as a function of all other flags in the other validation subfolders, e.g. wp942Val220Test010, which are the results of all validation tests.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/ValidationLog
table.description:
This data model is to create a table in the Validation Database to keep all the logging messages issued by validation tasks in the Integration/Operation stages.
Requested by Mantis issue 32454

parameter.name: dataTime
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: level
parameter.detailed-description: The log4j provides logging levels: DEBUG, ERROR, FATAL, INFO, TRACE, WARN

parameter.name: className
parameter.detailed-description: The full class name of the caller issuing the logging request

parameter.name: line
parameter.detailed-description: The line of code where the logging request is issued

parameter.name: message
parameter.detailed-description: The message the logging issue, usually the exception message.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Validation/ValidationTestResult
table.description: This data model stores the validation test case result flag at a particular archive release. Test MUST update the flag status at any possible ending point in the test code. The choice of flag status MUST follow the definition of the ValidationTestResultFlag.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: flag
parameter.detailed-description: test result flag accepts values of Enum ValidationTestResultFlag class

parameter.name: FAILED
parameter.description: Test failed. The test condition is not met.

parameter.name: EXCEPTION
parameter.detailed-description: For task that throws an exception, the task is interrupted.

parameter.name: WARNING
parameter.description: Test passed, but warning is raised.

parameter.name: PENDING
parameter.detailed-description: This is one of the default value.

parameter.name: SKIPPED
parameter.detailed-description: This is one of the default value.

parameter.name: ERROR
parameter.description: Test ended with an error returned from Tap service.
parameter.detailed-description: If an asynchronous job ends in ERROR, ValidationTools returns a null VOTableReader. This situation is usually caused by format error in the query, but other situations related to Tap service are possible.

table.description: This table stores the metadata necessary to replicate a visualization Octree.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: octantId
parameter.detailed-description: Unique identifier of a given octant.

parameter.name: visualizationId
parameter.detailed-description: Unique visualization identifier to which this Octree octant belongs.

parameter.name: parentId
parameter.detailed-description:
Identifier of the parent Octant.
{\bf Note:} for the root octant the parent identifier is the identifier of the octant.

parameter.name: position
parameter.detailed-description: The position of the octant in the visualization reference frame.

parameter.name: halfsizes
parameter.detailed-description: The half-sizes of each dimension of each dimension of the octant. In the visualization reference frame.

parameter.name: childrenOctants
parameter.detailed-description: An array with the unique identifiersof each child octant.

parameter.name: numberOfParticles
parameter.detailed-description: Number of particles inside this and all of its children octants.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Visualization/Properties/AxisProps
table.description: This table stores the properties of each of the axis used in the visualizations, including user defined ones.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: axisId
parameter.detailed-description: An unique identifier of the axis.

parameter.name: label
parameter.detailed-description: A string enconding the text to be displayed as the axis label.

parameter.name: limits
parameter.detailed-description: A vector with the minimum and maximum values to be displayed in the axis.

parameter.name: majorTicks
parameter.detailed-description: This is a string enconding the axis' major ticks information. The actual encoding scheme is still TBD (as of 18th march 2014).

parameter.name: minorTicks
parameter.detailed-description: This is a string enconding the axis' minor ticks information. The actual encoding scheme is still TBD (as of 18th march 2014).

parameter.name: displayAxis
parameter.detailed-description: A flag indicating whether or not the application should display the axis.

parameter.name: displayLabel
parameter.detailed-description: A flag indicating whether or not the application should display the label.

parameter.name: displayMajorTicks
parameter.detailed-description: A flag indicating whether or not the application should display the major ticks.

parameter.name: displayMinorTicks
parameter.detailed-description: A flag indicating whether or not the application should display the minor ticks.

parameter.name: position
parameter.detailed-description: The axis position in the visualization space. The adopted coordinates are those used in the visualization where the axis is displayed.

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.detailed-description: Axis' orientation vector. It is a unitary vector that is given in the same visualization reference frame.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Visualization/Properties/CameraProps
table.description: This table stores the information about the camera / window used in the visualization.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: cameraId
parameter.detailed-description: The unique camera identifier.

parameter.name: position
parameter.detailed-description: The camera position in the visualization space. The adopted coordinates are those used in the visualization where the camera is used.

parameter.name: fov
parameter.detailed-description: Camera's Field-of-view (FoV) angle in the Y direction in degrees.

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.detailed-description: Camera's orientation vector. It is a unitary vector that is given in the same visualization reference frame.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Visualization/Properties/GlyphProps
table.description: This table stores the information about non standard glyphs used in the visualization.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: glyphId
parameter.detailed-description: The unique glyph identifier.

parameter.name: name
parameter.detailed-description: The name of the glyph.

parameter.name: texture
parameter.detailed-description: A base64 enconding of the texture to use.

parameter.name: dimensions
parameter.detailed-description: A vector with the texture width [0] and height [1] in pixels.

table.name: DPC/CU9/Visualization/Properties/UserProps
table.description: This table stores the properties adopted by the user of the visualization framework.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: userPropId
parameter.detailed-description: A unique user properties identifier.

parameter.name: cameraPropsId
parameter.detailed-description: The id of the initial camera properties. The camera properties are stored at the Visualization/Properties/CameraProps table.

parameter.name: axisPropsIds
parameter.detailed-description: This vector points to the ids of the axis used in the visualization. The axis are stored in the Visulization/Properties/AxisProps table.

parameter.name: projection
parameter.detailed-description: This is an enumeration indicating what is the type of projection adopted for the visualization.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: particleId
parameter.detailed-description: The unique particle identifier of the visualization.

parameter.name: sourceId
parameter.detailed-description: The unique source identifier from the original data table.

parameter.name: position
parameter.detailed-description: The particle position in the visualization reference frame. These positions are computed using the dimensions expressions in the Visualization/VisualizationMetaData table.

parameter.name: size
parameter.detailed-description: The computed size of the particle in pixels.

parameter.name: color
glyph
parameter.detailed-description: The identifier of the glyph adopted for this particle. The glyph data is stored at Visualization/Properties/GlyphProps table.

parameter.name: type
parameter.detailed-description: This indicates the type of the particle.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: visualizationId
parameter.detailed-description: A unique visualization identifier.

parameter.name: sourceTableId
parameter.detailed-description: The identifier of the source table used in the visualization.

parameter.name: dimensionExpressions
parameter.detailed-description: This vector encodes how the dimensions are calculated from the original data in the table. For instance: in order to visualize a 2D color-magnitude diagram, one needs to compute the color, thus a possible dimension expression vector would be [B-V, V], where B and V are columns names of the table indicated in the sourceTableId.

parameter.name: sizeExpression
parameter.detailed-description: This string encodes how the size of each particle is calculated from the original data in the table.

parameter.name: colorExpression
parameter.detailed-description: This string encodes how the particle colors are calculated from the original data in the table.

parameter.name: glyphExpression
parameter.detailed-description: This encodes how the particle glyphs are calculated from the original data in the table.

parameter.name: mappers
parameter.detailed-description: Identifiers of the mappers used in the visualization. The vector encodes the identifiers of mappers for size [0], color [1] and glyph [2].

table.name: DPC/CU9/Visualization/VisualizationTable
table.description:
This table stores the visualization data and metadata.
{\bf Note:} The data might be persisted on disk in a separate file, while the metadata must be persisted in the DB tables.

parameter.name: solutionId
parameter.detailed-description: The data in the MDB will be described by means of a "Solution identifier" parameter. This will be a numeric field attached to each table row that can be used to unequivocally identify the version of all the subsystems that where used in the generation of the data as well as the input data used.Each DPC generating the data will have the freedom to choose the Solution identifier number, but they must ensure that given the Solution identifier they can provide detailed information about the "conditions" used to generate the data: versions of the software, version of the data used,...

parameter.name: visualizationId
parameter.detailed-description: Unique identifier of the visualization.

parameter.name: data
parameter.detailed-description: This stores the data used in the visualization.

parameter.name: metadata
parameter.detailed-description: This stores the visualization metadata.
